channel.title: How to change command playerrights

item.title: How to change command playerrights
item.dc:creator: @_sarah1 _sarah_
item.description:
@_sarah1 wrote:

I think he means where the playerrights are

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights == 2) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 200000 && newNPC >= 0) { c.npcId2 = newNPC; c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true); } else { c.sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: How to change command playerrights

item.description:
@RyRyscape wrote:

I don’t really get what you’re asking. If you want to make it so that only owners can use that command, post it under public void ownerCommands

item.title: How to change command playerrights
item.dc:creator: @magpkz magpkz
item.description:
@magpkz wrote:

Hey it dosnt say playerrights = (this is pi)
it says
(How do i change all the commands playerrights?)

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pnpc”))
{
try {
int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5));
if (newNPC <= 200000 && newNPC >= 0) {
c.npcId2 = newNPC;
c.isNpc = true;
c.updateRequired = true;
c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
}
else {
c.sendMessage(“No such P-NPC.”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #”);
}
}

Read full topic
